value: content= Ekenäs is a coastal town at the edge of an archipelago, part of which is the

. It has a pretty old town consisting of narrow streets of wooden houses. A medieval castle of Raseborg located in Ekenäs (formerly in the municipality of Snappertuna) gives name to the newly formed town.

content= Pohja is one of the birthplaces of Finnish metal industry. Fiskars Corporation was founded near Pohja in 17th Century. Today
is also known as a centre of art and design.

is located in Raseborg. Jussarö is in fact an island, where iron ore was mined once. Between 1967-2005 the island was used by the army. Since then it is accessible for the public again and it is even possible to stay over night there.
Karis can be reached by route 51 from
. It is located about 80 km west from the capital. After another 20 km along route 25 in direction of

you will arrive to Ekenäs.
From
you can arrive via highway E18 and route 52, the distance is about 115 km to Ekenäs.

content= A pretty medieval castle (from 14th Century). Originally it was located near the sea shore, but due the post-glacial rise of land it eventually lost it's access to the sea and therefore also it's strategic importance. Café Slottsknektens stuga (
) near the ruin was open already in 1893 to serve tourists. Apart from offering refreshments, it sells tickets to the castle and provides local information.  A beautiful forest path,
(Lovers’ Walk), leads from the castle ruins to the folk museum "Snappertuna Forngård".
name= Ekenäs Archipelago National Park Visitor Centre
content=The museum shows life at the Fiskars Ironworks from the 17th century to present days.
